intro: Cacalia gomphrena, commonly known as the Mexican fireweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, spiky purple or pink bracts that resemble small flowers, giving it a striking appearance. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Cacalia gomphrena is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
